column5: Morning from NWO.4c and sunny.Looks like a lot of nights will stay above zero and pretty high Temps to start the melt down.Only about 30" of ice to go.
I'll be going through your area May 17. My first opener was in 1984 and have missed only 3 since then. Missed: 2017, 2020 & 2021.
Should be good to go.Where you headed.
Little Vermilion. Would like to arrive while ice is on part of the lake. Fishing during time of change is rewarding.
You never know what you get dealt.But I would bet it will be gone.Are you there for the bass

Only a few sm in LV that probably made it up the Chukuni from Red Lake, somehow getting over the flume dam. 2 1/2 to 3'. I have seen them, but haven't tried to catch any. Will hook into plenty of huge pike and lots of small to medium walleyes. Going in 2 days prior to the opener and will eat a couple of 26" pike until Saturday opener.
